metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000559 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
qutebrowser version introduced in v0.11.0(1179ee7a937fb31414d77d9970bac21095358449) contains a Cross Site Scripting(XSS) vulnerability in history command, qute://history page that can resultin Via injected JavaScript code, a website can steal the user's browsinghistory. This attack appear to be exploitable via the victim must open apage with a specially crafted <title> attribute, and then open thequte://history site via the :history command. This vulnerability appears tohave been fixed in fixed in v1.3.3(4c9360237f186681b1e3f2a0f30c45161cf405c7, to be released today) and v1.4.0(5a7869f2feaa346853d2a85413d6527c87ef0d9f, released later this week).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qutebrowser - 1.10.1-1
qutebrowser-qtwebengine - 1.10.1-1
qutebrowser-qtwebkit - 1.10.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qutebrowser package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.1-1').
